data.title: [Feature Request] Add grouped by folder view to git

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.10

It would be nice to have a grouped by folder visualization mode for the git pane. It is quite useful when you're verifying what you're gonna pack in a commit.

data.title: [snippets] Support for regular expressions with Snippet Variables
data.body:
It'd be nice if regular expression support is added to the new snippet syntax (great work btw!! 👍). With variables such as "TM_FILENAME", the *extension* of the file is also added when the snippet is expanded, and when using snippets in code (eg. React), it's rarely the case that I'd need the extension of the file, thus I feel the need to have functionality to remove it from the replaced string.

I think this might be related closely to https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/6920?
Ref: https://manual.macromates.com/en/snippets Section 7.2

data.title: Update the f# grammar
data.body:
The latest version of the f# grammar is now maintained in https://github.com/ionide/ionide-fsgrammar  and we should update the one we bundle to it.

For background pls see https://github.com/ionide/ionide-atom-fsharp/issues/255#issuecomment-269098830

It turns out that the F# extension bundles this grammar, so we should discuss whether we want to continue bundle a grammer and other language support with VS Code.

data.title: VS code suddenly stopped generating .js after .ts changes. 2 hours have gone, still can't figure out why.
Refresh button in search
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

The refresh button in search should be always enabled instead of an empty entry.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Select the `Search Tab`
2. Write something
3. The refresh button is disabled

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7959437/21472428/23faef9c-caa7-11e6-8ad2-49e9d9adb0f4.png)

It only gets enabled when you hit enter, after that you can reproduce the steps below and it'll work. However if you clear the search result, the refresh button will be disabled until you hit enter again.

Thanks.

data.title: Cython extension issue, under Ubuntu only.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:41:20.664Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-57-generic
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.5|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.51|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.9.3|
|cython|tcwalther|0.1.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open Visual Studio Code
2. Make sure the extension tcwalther.cython is installed and activated
3. Create a new Cython file (.pyx)
4. Insert some basic text that complies with Cython's syntax, eg: "int"

Expected output:
The text that complies with Cython's syntax should be highlighted

Actual output:
Under this environment(see system, VSC and extension details above), with tcwalther.cython extension activated (yes, seriously), the text is not highlighted.

Notes:
I've tried those steps in a Windows7 environment, and it works fine.

|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.1.0|
|theme-glacier|Tyriar|0.0.10|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.3.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.2|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.5|

data.title: node.dll is out of date
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: OS1607 V10.0.14393.576

Secunia informs me that "C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\node.dll" is insecure, and gives it a threat rating of 3/5.  The Secunia message says, `The version detected of Node.js 6.x was 6.5.0.0 while the latest version including one or more security fixes is 6.9.0.'

I already had the 64-bit node.msi version 7.3.0.0 installed in "C:\Program Files\nodejs\node.exe".  I then installed the 32-bit node.msi V7.3.0.0 as well, but as one would expect, "C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\node.dll" was not updated.  (The LTS version is 6.9.2, which would be enough to satisy Secunia.)

* Neither the 64-bit nor the 32-bit installation directories of node has any file called node.dll.
* The node.js website has no mention of node.dll.

QUESTIONS:
1.  How do I update the insecure node.dll file?
2.  Why is VSCode incorporating an out-of-date and insecure node.dll file into its VSCode installation directory, rather than relying on an independent installation of node?

data.title: Code editor becomes unresponsive after updating some extension. Reload works after trying to close window. Then dialog becomes visible.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.0.18|
|django-html|bibhasdn|1.2.0|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.1.4|
|jquerysnippets|donjayamanne|0.0.1|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.5|
|xml|DotJoshJohnson|1.6.1|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.3.4|
|vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.1.5|
|CppSnippets|hars|0.0.5|
|format-indent|Kasik96|1.3.0|
|vscode-JS-CSS-HTML-formatter|lonefy|0.2.2|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.9.3|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.6.2|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.4.1|
|sass-indented|robinbentley|1.3.0|
|Angular2|UVBrain|0.3.5|
|cordova-tools|vsmobile|1.2.4|
|JavaScriptSnippets|xabikos|1.2.0|
|ReactSnippets|xabikos|1.2.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Code shows that some extension has an upgrade pending. Press Upgrade button
2. Once this is done, Code shows Reload button next to the upgraded extension.
3. Press Reload button -> nothing happens.
4. Click x-button to close Code from the top right corner (maybe restarting it also reloads the extension)
   -> now the extension's reload "are you sure?" dialog becomes visible and I can reload the extension. No need to restart whole program.
So is the dialog behind some other windows or why wasn't it shown first?

data.title: Convert width of space indentation

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I frequently receive content indented using 2 spaces and need to change it to 4. The steps for converting to one space indentation width to another are as so:

1. Detect indentation from contents
2. Convert space indentations to tabs
3. Change tab indentation width to desired, e.g. 4 ("indent using tabs" command)
4. Convert tab indentations to spaces

Could we possibly make this a one command process?

data.title: Allow to preview theme on mouse hover
data.body:
It would be nice to be able to preview Color Theme on hover before choosing. The name of the theme doesn't always speak for itself and the user have to go through the menus again to try another theme or go back to previous one.
UPDATE: As mentioned by @dfroze it is possible with the keyboard though i still think it will be much easier with the mouse.

data.title: tasks.json config g++ occur error: no input files in vscode
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Mac OS 10.10.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. I config my tasks.json file, cpplint is via pip install cpplint by myself

```
{
    /*
     * http://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/tasks
     * 2016.12.23
     */
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "sh",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "showOutput": "always",
    "args": [
        "-c"
    ],
    "tasks": [
        {
            "taskName": "cpplint",
            "suppressTaskName": true,
            "args": [
                "cpplint --verbose=0 --output=vs7 --linelength=80 ${cwd}/*.*"
            ]
        },
        {
            "taskName": "g++ -std=c++11 -Wall ${file} -o ${fileBasenameNoExtension}.o",
            "args": [
                //"g++ -std=c++11 -Wall ${file} -o ${fileBasenameNoExtension}.o"
            ]
        }
    ]
}
```
2. I have a problem is about taskName "g++", when I enter

```
"taskName": "g++"
"args": ["g++ -std=c++11 -Wall ${file} -o ${fileBasenameNoExtension}.o"]
```
and press `cmd+p` , type `task g++` , it will return a error:

clang: error: no input files

But, cpplint (you need $ pip install cpplint by youself) also have no parameter, it's work well, why? THX.

data.title: Intellisense suggestions are awful. Unintuitive ordering, poor completions, and tons of irrelevant snippets.
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.8.1 - OS Version: MacOS Sierra Steps to Reproduce: I've been frustrated with VSCode's suggestions for a while now, but I've been assuming it was my own ignorance of the feature. After reading [the docs](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/intellisense), however, I still don't understand why my suggestions are so awful. For example, in my TypeScript files I have MANY instances of the word `this` but when I type `t` the highlighted suggestion is `to` despite the fact that `to` is used absolutely nowhere in my file. I have many instances of `console.log` but I have to type `conso` to even get a `console` suggestion and even then it NEVER offers the appropriate `console.log` as a snippet. When I type `log` I get a `log()` function snippet despite no usage of that function by itself. I type `c` and the highlighted suggestion is `col` for no apparent reason. Again, I have zero instances of `col`. If I type `con` why is stuff like `ConstrainDOMString` (which I don't use) prioritized before `console.log`? I type `a` and I see obscure terms like `AssignedNodesOptions` but no `Array`! I have to scroll the suggestion list to see `Array`. You're probably getting the picture now. There's so many irrelevant completions and snippets that popup that I often just manually type my variable names. Intellisense feels broken like it's not intelligently doing anything but a simply context-free dictionary lookup. Sublime Text 3 had better "intellisense". Here's a simplified example of this issue: `col` is NOT an intelligent suggestion in that context.

data.title: [Feature Request]: Filters
data.body:
Please add the feature to add **filters for directories** inside the editor.

It may be done by creating some _meta file_ (thats also not listed in the file-tree) which contains the information what type of files to show and what not:
For **example** I want to exclude files from showing up by the suffix. When I am writing TypeScript code for example only ".ts" files and not ".js" files should be shown. Or when I am coding in Python ".pyc" files should be excluded from view because those don't matter to the user but the interpreter.
